ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
What is your overall rating of the primary instructor?
The primary instructor's sensitivity to students and ability to provide students with adequate feedback was:

narratives.question_text: Indicate the total number of hours per week (outside the classroom) you spent on this course:
comments: 4 hours
1 hr
3-4 hours
2-3 hrs/wk

narratives.question_text: Looking back on this course, what is your overall assessment of the course:  What are its strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might it be improved?
comments: Overall this is a great course. Occupational population is a very important part in our society and almost everyone is one of it. This course teaches us basic knowledge and methods on the prevention of the occupation associated injuries and diseases, which I think is very useful in the future career.

I think this course does a great job introducing different topics in occupational health. The class allows for a lot of discussion and gives students the ability to participate and give their input based on the courses they have previously taken.
Excellent course!
The class was great. Provide good understanding of epidemiology in Environmental and occupational setting

narratives.question_text: Please evaluate the instructor of this course. What are the instructor's strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might his or her teaching be improved?
comments: Instructor: Mark Bernard Russi  Dr Russi is a great mentor. His teaching is really inspiring.
Instructor: Mark Bernard Russi  Mark did a really great job facilitating discussion and making students feel comfortable for participating.
Instructor: Mark Bernard Russi  Prof. Russi and Prof. Slade are the coolest professors ever. I thoroughly enjoyed their lectures and learnt a lot from them.
Instructor: Mark Bernard Russi  Mark is the best instructor I have ever met. His teaching style is fabulous.

Instructor: Mark Bernard Russi  Dr. Russi is one of the most knowledgable professor I know, who is not a fan of using typed lecture notes, however his "old fashioned" teaching method is efficient, especially with his explicit explanation and impressively precise quoting of cases and numbers from journal papers. Dr. Russi is very kind, and he talks with students, provides feedback and suggestions in an encouraging way.
Instructor: Mark Bernard Russi  Great teacher, easy to understand and very knowledgable
Instructor: Martin David Slade  Dr. Slade is also a great teacher. His way of teaching is funny and inspiring.
Instructor: Martin David Slade  Marty did a great job facilitating discussion.
Instructor: Martin David Slade  Prof. Russi and Prof. Slade are the coolest professors ever. I thoroughly enjoyed their lectures and learnt a lot from them.
Instructor: Martin David Slade  Great teacher, explained statistic in an easy understanding way

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize this course for a fellow student? Would you recommend it to another student? Why or why not?
comments: I strongly recommend this course to other students because this course is very important for public health students and the teachers are wonderful.
This class is a great overview in different aspects of occupational epidemiology. It really allows you to apply your basic epi skills to challenges in occupational settings.
Definitely recommend it!
This class help you plan and critic epidemiological studies especially in occupational setting
